articles.title: U.S. to evacuate Americans quarantined by coronavirus on Japan cruise ship
articles.description: Aircraft will be used to evacuate Americans quarantined by the coronavirus on a cruise ship in Japan. The voluntary evacuations begin Sunday, even as the virus continues to spread on board. Worldwide, tens of thousands of cases have been confirmed and more th…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Pangolin facing greater threat of extinction during coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: The pangolin has spent most of its existence in obscurity, but after a group of Chinese scientists recently labeled the mammal as a potential transmitter of the novel coronavirus, they are facing a threat of extinction. Tom Hanson reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Coronavirus panic could be the endangered pangolin's new threat
articles.description: Bill Zeigler, a top researcher at Chicago's Brookfield Zoo, shared his concerns.
articles.content: The pangolin, once called "the most trafficked mammal in the world," is facing another threat over its potential link to the coronavirus. Scientists working around the clock to save the species worry that Chinese researchers who labeled pangolins as the possi… [+1711 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus-quarantined cruise passengers battle illness, boredom

articles.title: Pangolins could face greater threat due to coronavirus fears

articles.title: France announces 1st coronavirus death in Europe
articles.description: The CDC says the new coronavirus could be around for at least another year.
articles.content:
The U.S. Embassy in Japan said Americans aboard a quarantined cruise ship will be flown back home on a chartered flight Sunday. 
The Diamond Princess cruise ship, which has docked at the port city of Yokohama, is carrying about 380 Americans. So far, 218 peo… [+792 chars]
